Package com.xm.cryptorecservice.controller

Class CryptoRecController

java.lang.Object
com.xm.cryptorecservice.controller.CryptoRecController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/cryptorecapi") @Validated public class CryptoRecController extends Object
A RestController responsible for serving up endpoints, receiving and sending data to the user.

  • Method Details

    • getAggregateStats

      @GetMapping("/aggregate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAggregateStats()
      Return the aggregate stats for all loaded cryptos. Those include minimum price, maximum price, first price, last price, price range (max - min), price difference (last - first) and normalized price ( (max - min) / min).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing a JSON payload with crypto names as keys, and the aforementioned stats as values. The response payload is sorted lexicographically by keys, in ascending order.
      See Also:
      • getAggregateStats(String)

    • getAggregateStats

      @GetMapping("/aggregate/{cryptoName}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAggregateStats(@PathVariable @NotBlank @NotBlank String cryptoName) throws UnsupportedCryptoException
      Get aggregate stats for a specific crypto. Those include minimum price, maximum price, first price, last price, price range (max - min), price difference (last - first) and normalized price ((max - min) / min).
      Parameters:
      cryptoName - The crypto to return aggregate stats for.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity with a single entry consisting of the provided crypto as the key and the aforementioned stats as the value.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedCryptoException - if the user provides an unsupported cryptocurrency.
      See Also:
      • getAggregateStats()

    • getCryptosSortedByNormalizedPrice

      @GetMapping("/sorted") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getCryptosSortedByNormalizedPrice()
      Return the cryptos sorted by normalized aggregate price, in descending order.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the cryptos as keys and their normalized aggregate price as values, where the entries are sorted in descending order by the values.

    • bestCryptoOfTheDay

      @GetMapping("/bestofday") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> bestCryptoOfTheDay(@RequestParam(name="date") @NotBlank @NotBlank String date) throws BadDateFormatException, DateOutOfStoredRangeException
      Returns the crypto with the highest normalized price for the given day.
      Parameters:
      date - A date string, which MUST be in YYYY-mm-dd format.
      Returns:
      A single entry consisting of the crypto with the highest normalized price for the given day as the key, and that normalized price as the value.
      Throws:
      BadDateFormatException - If the date string provided is NOT in YYYY-mm-dd format.
      DateOutOfStoredRangeException - If the date provided does not have data for ANY supported cryptocurrency.
